snippet: The chief architect of a clandestine campaign of targeted killings, John O. Brennan, will face a Senate confirmation hearing as President Obama’s nominee for C.I.A. director.
abstract: John O Brennan, chief architect of clandestine campaign of targeted killings of suspected Al Qaeda militants in Yemen by drones, will face Senate confirmation hearing as Pres Obama’s nominee for Central Intelligence Agency director; hazards of drone strikes, including deaths of civilians along with militants, will face rare public scrutiny.

byline.original: By ROBERT F. WORTH, MARK MAZZETTI and SCOTT SHANE
byline.contributor: Robert F. Worth reported from Sana, and Mark Mazzetti and Scott Shane from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The chief architect of a clandestine campaign of targeted killings, John O. Brennan, will face a Senate confirmation hearing as President Obama’s nominee for C.I.A. director.

headline.seo: With Brennan Pick, a Light on Drone Strikes’ Hazards
headline.main: Drone Strikes’ Risks to Get Rare Moment in the Public Eye
headline.print_headline: Hazards of Drone Strikes Face Rare Public Scrutiny

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
